isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - OPERATION - DIGITAL ODOMETER/HOURMETER DISPLAY (OPTIONAL)

svcprocinfo.para: This feature is an internal part of the Speedo/Tach module. It displays miles, trip miles, engine hours and trip engine hours. The user may step through the modes by depressing the momentary switch located by the speedometer gauge bezel. The name of the parameter being displayed changes as the switch is depressed. Trip hours and trip miles may be cleared by depressing the button for three seconds.

The display module may be replaced by the user. The data for the display is stored in Speedo/Tach module microprocessor memory. After replacing the display, the module provides the previous mileage and engine hour data. Replacing the Speedo/Tach module will provide zeroed values for all odometer functions.

svcsubproc.title: Battery Voltage To Speedo/Tach Module
svcsubproc.para: The Speedo/Tach module receives battery voltage (key ON or OFF) from 15A fuse F5-C. This voltage is only necessary with modules having the digital display unit. When the key is turned OFF, the battery voltage is needed only for the next few seconds for the Speedo/Tach module to save the odometer/hourmeter data in memory. Other than those couple of seconds, if the batteries are disconnected, it will not affect the Speedo/Tach module.
